I had to climb out the same way.

topics.body:
So I just got done watching Episode 13 of Attack on Titan.
God this show still continues to astound me, despite those scenes where [spoiler]a rich merchant was prepare to sacrifice so many people just to protect his damn goods, and that once scene where the cowardly officer nearly killed Eren and his friends and was acting like an utter paranoid idiot. Thank god Mikasa and Pixis were able to talk sense into them and stop their BS from causing any damage or harm to anyone. But seriously, screw those guys. I hope Titans find them and eat them.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]And Marco's dead. Well...crap.
He wasn't one of my favorites, but I did like him and I though he had potential and would laster longer. What I did like and remember out of him while he lasted, was his knightly and level-headed personality, and I did like his friendship with Jean. I don't think he was a great fighter, but he could keep up and had potential for growth.
But he's officially the first casualty out of the Top 10 of the 104th. Rest in peace, dude.
One down, nine more to go.[/spoiler]

And now the Survey Corps people have showed up. So far, I'm looking into the eccentric Hange, and of course, the ever-popular stoic Levi. Hope they can win me over. Especially if Levi CAN outdo both Mikasa and Eren [spoiler]in Titan form[/spoiler], if what I've been told both in-show and outside.
But why in the heck does Hange seem so dang similar to Sasha, except..._smarter, and much more deadly?_ This really weirds me out...

Speaking of Eren:
[spoiler]!http://img4.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20130630011312/shingekinokyojin/images/2/2e/Eren_carries_the_boulder.png!
DAT ATLAS REFERENCE
AND THE MUSIC THAT WAS PLAYING DURING THAT SCENE
SO FREAKING AWESOME AND BEAUTIFUL[/spoiler]

Well I'm done raving about Attack on Titan for now. Still got a bunch more episodes to catch up on, and I can't wait for what crazy thrills and twists happens next!
topics.author: 536f7a11636872666e2d0000
